channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: President Trump takes aim at college sports with a new executive order
item.description: The order aims to ban "pay-for-play" NIL deals, mandates scholarships for women's and Olympic sports and threatens to withhold funds from schools who ...

item.title: Home swept away amid flash flooding in New Mexico mountain village
item.description: Another afternoon of heavy rainfall has prompted flash flooding in the southern New Mexico mountain village of Ruidoso.

item.title: Five ice hockey players found not guilty in Canada sexual assault case
item.description: The verdict marks the end of the highly publicised case, in which the men were accused of sexually assaulting a woman in 2018.

item.title: Too hot for Santa as Lapland buckles under record heatwave
item.description: After an unusually cold early summer, the whole of Finland has been plunged into two weeks of high temperatures.

item.title: 3/24/2024: The Right to be Wrong; AMLO; Law of the Sea
item.description: First, a report on the spread of misinformation on social media. Then, Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador: The 60 Minutes Interview. And, U...

item.title: U.S. Department of Justice sues NYC over sanctuary city laws
item.description: It comes less than a week after a Customs and Border Patrol officer was shot by an undocumented immigrant​.

item.title: A man is halted climbing the US-Mexico border wall. Under new Trump rules, US troops sound the alarm
CBS Texas to host benefit concert for flood victims
item.description: As Central Texas recovers from deadly floods, CBS Texas is hosting the "Loud for Love" concert to support victims.

item.title: France will recognise Palestinian state, Macron says
item.description: France to become the first G7 state to recognise the state of Palestine, as Israeli PM Netanyahu condemns decision.

item.title: One in five children in Gaza City is malnourished, UN aid agency says
item.description: The UN agency for Palestinians says it has thousands of truckloads of supplies near Gaza which it wants to deliver.

item.title: Powell disagrees with Trump about cost of changes to Fed construction
item.description: President Trump visited the Federal Reserve's headquarters in Washington, keeping up the intense pressure he's been putting on Fed chair Jerome Powell...

item.title: Six months in, how Trump has changed the Education Department.
item.description: Federal education policy has seen a lot of changes since President Trump's inauguration. For example, the Department of Education itself, which Trump ...

item.title: Trump administration approves sale of CBS parent company Paramount
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission approved the sale of Paramount Global after the buyer made pledges to showcase a diversity of viewpoints and roo...

item.title: European countries are set for Iran talks, but expectations for a breakthrough are low
item.description: Germany, France and the United Kingdom will hold talks with Iran in Istanbul Friday, just days after the three European nations warned they would reim...

item.title: Supreme Court blocks rule that blocks Voting Rights Act for now
item.description: The order guarantees voters, at least for now, the ability to sue to enforce rights guaranteed under the landmark 1965 law.

item.title: Pro-Palestinian convict to be freed by France after 41 years
item.description: Georges Abdallah will immediately be expelled to his native Lebanon after his release on Friday.

item.title: Trump’s settlement with Columbia could become a model for his campaign to reshape higher education
